fields.description:

2006-04-06 10:29:20,460 INFO [imports.importer.impl.ImportLogger] Reindexing last 50 issues imported ... (89491.151s)

fields.description:
In the Russian locale, the pop-up calendar does not display the correct date.

To reproduce:

# Set Locale to Russian
# Select a date (e.g. with month May) from pop-up calendar on a date field - e.g. Due Date
# Click on calendar icon again to display pop-up calendar.
# Note that the incorrect date is shown (normally the month June is displayed) in the pop-up and does not correspond to the previously selected date.

This appears to only occur for Russian locale.
fields.summary: Calendar: incorrect date shown in pop-up when using Russian locale.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9896].
  {panel}

Some users would like to create a new option value in an already present custom field (eg. select list, multi-select list). 

A use case for this would be a custom field select list that is a 'build number':

* Create a new build number option as part of the Jelly script or SOAP service.
* Create a group of issues via Jelly or SOAP that has this new build number selected.
fields.summary: Allow the addition of option values to custom fields in Jelly

fields.description: Due to the mail-loop we've encountered, we now have Jira tickets numbered in the 20k up area. This confuses people for some reason. It might be handy to have an admin option to reuse sequence numbers from deleted tickets, though I can think of several good reasons why this would be a bad idea in general.
fields.summary: Cosmetic - reuse sequence numbers of deleted tickets
Ability to black list e-mail addresses for sending and receiving e-mail messages

fields.description: If you delete a user who is a component lead, then do something that causes the component lead (now deleted) to get a notification, the email will still try to be sent to the deleted guy.
fields.summary: Deleting a User doesn't remove them from the Component Lead

fields.description: Our project contained several filters that sorted by Issue Type.  When we were running 3.3.2, the sort order was whatever order was specified on the Issue Type page.  Since upgrading to 3.5.3, we created an Issue Type Scheme for our project specifying the same order.  When a user creates a new issue in our project, the order in the pick list is in the specified order.  Unfortunately, the filters now sort Issue Type alphabetically instead of by the specified order.  Because we use different issue types at each phase of our development lifecycle, this change in behavior has made these filters largely unusable.  Is there a way to configure the filters to revert to displaying Issue Types in the order specified as they did in 3.3.2?
fields.summary: Filters Display Issue Types In Alphabetical Order Instead of Issue Type Scheme Order After Upgrade to 3.5.3

fields.description:
In Russian locale, FixForVersion is translated as "Закрыт в версии:", which is actually "Is fixed in". This is the case in most screens and views. The problem is that this field is most frequently seen and used for bugs not fixed yet, so such a translation is highly misleading.

I would appreciate if translators give a second thought to this field. Some translation ideas to start with:
- "Закрыть в версии"
- "Закрыть к версии"
- "Исправить к версии"
- "Исправить в версии"
fields.summary: Russian: FixForVersion translated incorrectly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9836].
  {panel}

It would be great to be able to get a permalink to the current view you have in Jira (excluding personal portlets). 

i.e. if there was a "permalink" item next to the Print icon you could send what you are looking at to other people. Currently you cannot do this by copying links because they do not include all the parameters used to construct the view.

Also, as a side effect, this would mean you could fix the Print icon so it did the same and you could bookmark or send links to printable content.

This issue is a superset of JRA-7817
fields.summary: Permalinks for all views i.e. project Roadmap, personal Roadmap etc

fields.description:
This is a follow-on to #JRA-9798. I am trying to chase away all missing translations in non-admin pages. However, while in #JRA-9798 I was successful to identify the missing texts by fulltext searching in *.properties files, here I seem not to be able to do so. 

I am sending all the relevant files (*.properties, language_cs_CZ.jar and a screenshot of a page with texts I am trying to translate). Please, advise what's wrong.

Btw. referring to this problem, I have sent a recommendation to Ernest Wong of filling the missing translations (new texts you create in English) into translation files. This would spare me the labor of identifying the technical keys. I don't know if Ernest has created an enhancement request for that. If not, please create a low prio one. 

Another question: it seems that context help texts are not available in translation files (*.properties) If so, what are the plans about these?
fields.summary: Cannot succeed to translate a few texts

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9826].
  {panel}

Occasionally one wishes to query JIRA by the date a certain field last changed.  For example, to find:
 - issues where a work log was entered in the last month. 
 - issues whose fix-for version was set in the last month.
 - issues whose due date was set in the last month

If we could further specify _what value_ the field had to be before considering the date, we could search for issues *resolved* in the last month, aka Resolution Date ("issues where status became 'resolved' in the last month").
fields.summary: Search by date a field was last updated (eg. "issues with work logged in last week")

fields.description: Currently JIRA does not clone an issue's attachments when an issue is cloned. When an issue is cloned and contains attachments, JIRA should prompt the user if they want to clone the attachments as well.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9816].
  {panel}

RSS Feeds should send a 304 HTTP status and an empty body when the client sends an 'If-Modified-Since' header and the feed has not changed since the time specified.

Used technique defined in RFC2616 for sending the correct string for the If-Modified-Since header:

  To get best results when sending an If-Modified-Since header field
  for cache validation, clients are advised to use the exact date 
  string received in a previous Last-Modified header field whenever 
  possible.

Currently, JIRA always seems to send a 200 OK and the RSS feed as its body.

Filed this issue under Issue navigator because the RSS GET URL contains a call to IssueNavigator.jspa.
fields.summary: RSS Feeds should contain status code 304 when content has not changed

fields.description:
While migrating Issue Tracking data from an old system to JIRA, I noticed that issues that had multiple components specified ended up having no components in JIRA.  For example, consider the following jelly:

{code:xml}
<jira:CreateIssue project-key="MYP" issueType="Improvement" summary="A big issue" priority="Major" components="A,B,C" assignee="awhitford"
reporter="awhitford" description="You know" created="2004-06-27 16:41:21.0" updated="2006-01-04 15:25:03.0"
issueIdVar="myIssueID" issueKeyVar="myIssueKey"/>
{code}

Despite the attribute called *components* (_plural_), it only seems to work if I only mention _one_ component.  From browsing the source code, it would appear that it is not sophisticatd enough to detect the string as a list and parse it into an array or collection.  Unfortunately, the consequence is that multiple components may not be specified meaning that a manual procedure to "fix up" the data is necessary.
fields.summary: jira:CreateIssue via Jelly does not allow specifying multiple components

fields.description:
The documentation states "The release notes contain all issues within the specified project that are marked with a specific "Fix For" version". It seems this statement is not correct. Subtasks (which afaik are mostly handled and saved in the db like issues) are not shown when i use the standard release notes-template, although they are marked with the selected "fix for"-version. the parent issue gets displayed properly.
parent and subtasks have different "fix for"-versions.
The subtasks are properly displayed in filters (searching only with "fix for") and in the road map. This bug seems to be releated to JRA-5329.

We use the release notes to communicate with our clients, so it is now rather embarrassing to tell them it is not reliable. Is there a quick fix available i didn't see ?
fields.summary: Subtasks are not displayed in the Release Notes

fields.description:
I needed to number 5 rows, two of them were indented. The result looks like the outer rows are bulleted and the inner rows are numbered.

I struggled with this. In an earlier version I did not have a section and the last paragraph in this table cell looked like a continuation of the last indented numbered row. The section delimiter solved this problem but introduced the problem of numbered parapgraphs appearing as bullet points:

| 13376 | Anonymous outdialing may not work properly under Windows 2003. \\
\\
On Windows 2003 systems the Anonymous account is now _disabled_ by Microsoft on installation of the operating system. However, there is no visible place to configure this, and even when IIS and the virtual directory appear to be setup correctly for accessing via anonymous, it does not work. \\
\\
Solution: \\ {section}
# A DLL Microsoft leaves unregistered (*_Iissuba.dll_* --- which handles anonymous access for Windows 2003) must be registered. To do this, type the following at a command prompt, where systemroot is the system root directory (on a default installation, this is *_C:\Winnt_*): \\
\\ {{rundll32 systemroot\system32\iissuba.dll,RegisterIISSUBA}}
# Run all worker processes that use anonymous authentication under the identity of LocalSystem.
# Set the AnonymousPasswordSync metabase property to TRUE:
## At the command prompt, change to the IIS AdminScripts folder. By default, this folder is located at *_C:\Inetpub\AdminScripts_*.
## Type the following command, and then press {{<ENTER>}}: {{adsutil.vbs set W3svc/AnonymousPasswordSync true}}\\{section}
A more detailed article on this can be viewed at: \\
\\
[http://support.microsoft.com/default.aspx'scid=kb;en-us;332167&Product=iis60|http://support.microsoft.com/default.aspx?scid=kb;en-us;332167&Product=iis60] \\
\\
However, the only relevant portion of this article is the section at the bottom titled "_Configure Sub-Authentication on an IIS 6.0 Upgrade in Worker Process Isolation Mode_." |
fields.summary: Editing: having problems with numbered and unnumbered paragraphs in a table cell

fields.description:
As we are in the process of moving all projects from mantis to Jira we noticed that newly created projects (mainly imported from mantis) where immediately browseable by browsing to .../browse/ID-42, only the project portlet list on the dashboard has not yet picked them up. They appeared only after webserver restart (possibly after a long while - with one project we are not sure if the server was actually restarted or not).

Steps: 
* Import a new project from mantis
* Make sure the user you are testing with has access to this project
* Look at Project portal list (the one that adds a collapsible box for each project to the list) - the new project is not available in the list
* Note that it's also not in the projects list available at "Browse Project" in the "Home, Browse Project, Find Issues, ..." line on top of each page
* Manually browse the project, e.g. by browsing to .../browse/ID (substitute ID with the project ID that you gave in import.
* restart webserver (or be patient and wait for a long time - maybe it will show up without restart, I can't tell for sure)
* browse the project list again: Voila, It's there.

(I've just imported another project and will leave the office for tonight, I'll report tomorrow if it shows up)

I've prioritized this as minor because there's an easy workaround, but I've been somewhat puzzled about where my imported project is when I first imported some projects ... and missing projects are rather a major loss of functionality... Please decide for yourself and reprioritize if you like.
fields.summary: project list doesn't show new project imported from mantis

fields.description:
I'm using Axis to develop a client for the JIRA SOAP service.
Since the server name/URL is contained in the SOAP namespace the client code generated by Axis contains the server URL. That's a big problem because when the server moves I have to recompile my whole client application.
Therefore it would be good if the SOAP namespace would be configurable so the server URL could be removed and moves wouldn't cause a recompile auf my client application.
fields.summary: Make SOAP namespace configurable

fields.description:
When attachment a file to an issue it would be really great if the comment itself linked to the associated attachment.

It's often been commented on by our staff that when theres 3-4 attachments against an issue, finding which attachment is referenced by a comment usually requires feedback with the person attaching the issue.

i.e.  An SQL file is attached with a comment of "Run this SQL script prior to deploying version XXXX of the application".  If theres several files attached to the ticket, identifying exactly which attachment is being referenced is impossible.

This would also be usefull in the emailed comment template so that when a user reads the comment email, they have a hyperlink directly to the attachment - currently the emails don't even mention that the comment was the result of an attachment.
fields.summary: Attachment comments should link to the associated attachment
